page.title: 06Court Farm
page.content: Court Farm (CWRT in Welsh) is an historic{manor house,}which stands on a hill about half a mile North-West of St. Illtyd's Church. It is the only {Elizabethan House}remaining in Carmarthenshire and was used on{a 1757 {chart to guide vessels along the {Burry estuary. They took the tall {chimneys of the house and the church {tower as markers. Court Leets were {also held there. The house dates from the late fifteenth or early sixteenth century. In 1948 it was abandoned. Now it is a ruin-the grey stone building with its 'battlemented' wall looks down on the village. A group of local historians are trying to raise funds to restore the Court to its former glory.
